title.narrative: OUTPUT 3: INCREASE IN DEMAND FOR SKILLED CARE AND CARE-SEEKING BEHAVIOUR

description.narrative: By 2022, demand for skilled care is increased and care-seeking behaviour is improved in targeted communities, which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most at-risk newborns and children are benefiting from integrated newborn, child health interventions and healthy behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, demand for skilled care is increased and care-seeking behaviour is improved in targeted communities

description.narrative: With UNICEF support the federal and provincial health departments engaged in risk communication and community engagement activities to increase uptake of COVID-19 vaccines. UNICEF also supported social media listening, rebranded EPI centres, CSO engagement and social mobilization and mass awareness campaigns to create demand for typhoid (in Punjab) and measles-rubella (nationwide) vaccinations. These contributed to 94 million children vaccinated against measles-rubella (exceeding the target by 4 million) and 19.8 million against typhoid. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:29/12/2021
